pr_title: Fixes #761,  #3093 (svn history on renamed files, svn date parsing)

timeline.message: Fixes #761,  #3093 (svn history on renamed files, svn date parsed incorrectly)

timeline.bodyText:
Perhaps add e.g. static final String SVN_MILLIS_DATE_EG with the known-good format and then use SVN_MILLIS_DATE_EG.length() to avoid the unnamed literals here and the next line?
(This reminds of a TODO to refactor out of the old DateFormat for thread safety — and you've now made apparent also for microseconds handling.)
timeline.author: idodeclare

replies.bodyText:
Good idea.
Also thought it would be good to get rid of java.util.Date generally, but that seemed quite invasive for a first contribution!
replies.author: harrisric

replies.bodyText:

Having TODO's just in the source code is not good, filed  #3096 to track this.
replies.author: vladak

timeline.message: Refactor to use a example date to generate the length constant for date formatting
Use the same trick as other repo typos so that the .svn files are correctly included in the test data and zip.
Remember to delete the .svn folder too.
Change to load up a new subversion repository for tests based on a dumpfile.
Correct some EOL character issues in the dump file so it works on both windows and linux.
Attempt to fix dump file by importing and re-dumping on linux
temporarily remove dump file to try and clear line-ending issues.
New svn dump and amended test results to match

Amend test to reflect new repository added.
Change attributes to keep svn dump file working on windows and linux.

timeline.bodyText: This and the next line seem accidentally modified
timeline.author: idodeclare

timeline.bodyText: Please check formatting. Per @ahornace, "LineLength - standard is now 120 chars per line, but I kept it relaxed [for auto-checkstyle]"
timeline.author: idodeclare

timeline.bodyText:
I wonder if this might be clearer if you just used log data instead of deriving from a File that we just created from the same log data?
s.substring(prefix.length() + 1) (similar to line 126) since s I think would start with a / for Subversion?
timeline.author: idodeclare

replies.bodyText:
Thanks, but unfortunately not as simple as that - the use of File also means that we switch convention from forward-slash to back-slash as well.
I tried to write a unit test which showed this but that seems to show up the limitations of the SubversionHistoryParserTest using a fixed 'home' of '/' (which on windows might e.g. become 'C:' and therefore even with the current code appears to leave the leading-slash in place).
I've made the other formatting corrections suggested (hopefully caught them all - the 2-space indentation is the standard in my IDE at work).
replies.author: harrisric

replies.bodyText: Oh I see. Thank you for explaining. I forget the Windows considerations.
replies.author: idodeclare

timeline.message: Corrections to formatting and line length.
